name: Anthony Towns
cooked: The O(n^2) step to re-optimise the new chunks has to be performed per cluster (ie, it’s O(bc^2) where b is number of clusters, and c is chunks per cluster), so limiting the number of clusters that can be conflicted with would make sense. Affecting many clusters without actually combining those clusters as a result of the RBF seems like it would be unusual behaviour, too?

Affecting many clusters without actually combining those clusters as a result of the RBF seems like it would be unusual behaviour, too?
